page.title: 14FARMING_ FAT STOCK
page.content: {Fat stock farming}is the production of animals for{meat.Clawton}being mainly a{dairy farming}area fat stock farming is not highly intensive.Some of the smaller{farms}run a small suckler heard these consist mainly of the traditional beef breeds such as Devons"Red,Ruby",Herefords.These farmers usualy have a small flock of {breeding sheep}as well,the offsring from these cows and{ewes}are fattened on the farm on the lush grass available in the spring and{lambs}sold in the late Spring to early Summer,the{bullocks}graze on late in the Autumn and are then housed until the following Spring while they are housed they are fed{hay,silage}and {concentrates}and then turned out on to the lush grass and fattened on through the Summer and Autumn and are then sold to the{butchers}or{abbatoirs.}
